text: Onion farmer ako from mindoro. 26 cans na binhi ng red pinoy tinanim ko at an area of almost 3 hctars. Half i harvested feb 20 and the other half last mar.10. Ive sold all my products but too bad, total proceeds are not enough to cover for my expenses. The reason; mababang presyo! 18 per kilo on first harvest and 13 per kilo on 2nd harvest. Heartless traders and storage owners are convenient entities for DA to blame but in reality, the faults should be pointed to DA and sec. Pinols alipores for allowing too much imported onions get into RP. As early as january, bumabaha na ang sibuyas sa palengke, but now, DA blames the traders ang cold storage operators? What a farce! Privately owned cold storages are rented out basing from owner's business decision. They will most likely lease their facility to volume costumers who came early than to small onion farmers who came later. Also, DA can always dictate their will on publicly funded cold storage facilty. Why then blame the storage owners?
author: Felix Conde

text: these economic saboteurs, can we hang them in public
